intro: Panicum rigidulum, commonly known as stiff panicgrass, is a perennial grass native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist to wet soils. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often covered with fine, hairy structures, giving it a rigid appearance.
